ConfigureLogs.documentation: Changes the Channel's properities to configure log subscription
ConfigureLogs.name: ConfigureLogs

DescribeHarvestJob.documentation: Gets details about an existing HarvestJob.
DescribeHarvestJob.name: DescribeHarvestJob

DescribeOriginEndpoint.documentation: Gets details about an existing OriginEndpoint.
DescribeOriginEndpoint.name: DescribeOriginEndpoint

ListHarvestJobs.documentation: Returns a collection of HarvestJob records.
ListHarvestJobs.name: ListHarvestJobs

ListOriginEndpoints.documentation: Returns a collection of OriginEndpoint records.

RotateChannelCredentials.deprecatedMessage: This API is deprecated. Please use RotateIngestEndpointCredentials instead
RotateChannelCredentials.documentation: Changes the Channel's first IngestEndpoint's username and password. WARNING - This API is deprecated. Please use RotateIngestEndpointCredentials instead
RotateChannelCredentials.name: RotateChannelCredentials

RotateIngestEndpointCredentials.documentation: Rotate the IngestEndpoint's username and password, as specified by the IngestEndpoint's id.
RotateIngestEndpointCredentials.name: RotateIngestEndpointCredentials

AdTriggers.documentation:
A list of SCTE-35 message types that are treated as ad markers in the output.  If empty, no
ad markers are output.  Specify multiple items to create ad markers for all of the included
message types.

AdsOnDeliveryRestrictions.documentation:
This setting allows the delivery restriction flags on SCTE-35 segmentation descriptors to
determine whether a message signals an ad.  Choosing "NONE" means no SCTE-35 messages become
ads.  Choosing "RESTRICTED" means SCTE-35 messages of the types specified in AdTriggers that
contain delivery restrictions will be treated as ads.  Choosing "UNRESTRICTED" means SCTE-35
messages of the types specified in AdTriggers that do not contain delivery restrictions will
be treated as ads.  Choosing "BOTH" means all SCTE-35 messages of the types specified in
AdTriggers will be treated as ads.  Note that Splice Insert messages do not have these flags
and are always treated as ads if specified in AdTriggers.

CdnIdentifierSecret.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the secret in Secrets Manager that your Content Distribution Network (CDN) uses for authorization to access your endpoint.

SecretsRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the IAM role that allows MediaPackage to communicate with AWS Secrets Manager.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) assigned to the Channel.

CreatedAt.documentation: The date and time the Channel was created.

Description.documentation: A short text description of the Channel.

Id.documentation: The ID of the Channel.

ChannelCreateParameters.documentation: Configuration parameters for a new Channel.

Description.documentation: A short text description of the Channel.

Id.documentation:
The ID of the Channel. The ID must be unique within the region and it
cannot be changed after a Channel is created.

NextToken.documentation: A token that can be used to resume pagination from the end of the collection.

ChannelUpdateParameters.documentation: Configuration parameters for updating an existing Channel.

Description.documentation: A short text description of the Channel.

CmafEncryption.documentation: A Common Media Application Format (CMAF) encryption configuration.

ConstantInitializationVector.documentation: An optional 128-bit, 16-byte hex value represented by a 32-character string, used in conjunction with the key for encrypting blocks. If you don't specify a value, then MediaPackage creates the constant initialization vector (IV).

KeyRotationIntervalSeconds.documentation: Time (in seconds) between each encryption key rotation.

CmafPackage.documentation: A Common Media Application Format (CMAF) packaging configuration.

HlsManifests.documentation: A list of HLS manifest configurations

SegmentDurationSeconds.documentation:
Duration (in seconds) of each segment. Actual segments will be
rounded to the nearest multiple of the source segment duration.

SegmentPrefix.documentation: An optional custom string that is prepended to the name of each segment. If not specified, it defaults to the ChannelId.

CmafPackageCreateOrUpdateParameters.documentation: A Common Media Application Format (CMAF) packaging configuration.

HlsManifests.documentation: A list of HLS manifest configurations

Duration (in seconds) of each segment. Actual segments will be
rounded to the nearest multiple of the source segment duration.

SegmentPrefix.documentation: An optional custom string that is prepended to the name of each segment. If not specified, it defaults to the ChannelId.

CreateHarvestJobRequest.documentation: Configuration parameters used to create a new HarvestJob.

EndTime.documentation: The end of the time-window which will be harvested

Id.documentation:
The ID of the HarvestJob. The ID must be unique within the region
and it cannot be changed after the HarvestJob is submitted

OriginEndpointId.documentation:
The ID of the OriginEndpoint that the HarvestJob will harvest from.
This cannot be changed after the HarvestJob is submitted.

StartTime.documentation: The start of the time-window which will be harvested

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) assigned to the HarvestJob.

ChannelId.documentation: The ID of the Channel that the HarvestJob will harvest from.

CreatedAt.documentation: The date and time the HarvestJob was submitted.

EndTime.documentation: The end of the time-window which will be harvested.

Id.documentation:
The ID of the HarvestJob. The ID must be unique within the region
and it cannot be changed after the HarvestJob is submitted.

OriginEndpointId.documentation:
The ID of the OriginEndpoint that the HarvestJob will harvest from.
This cannot be changed after the HarvestJob is submitted.

StartTime.documentation: The start of the time-window which will be harvested.

Status.documentation:
The current status of the HarvestJob. Consider setting up a CloudWatch Event to listen for
HarvestJobs as they succeed or fail. In the event of failure, the CloudWatch Event will
include an explanation of why the HarvestJob failed.

CreateOriginEndpointRequest.documentation: Configuration parameters used to create a new OriginEndpoint.

ChannelId.documentation:
The ID of the Channel that the OriginEndpoint will be associated with.
This cannot be changed after the OriginEndpoint is created.

Description.documentation: A short text description of the OriginEndpoint.

Id.documentation:
The ID of the OriginEndpoint.  The ID must be unique within the region
and it cannot be changed after the OriginEndpoint is created.

ManifestName.documentation: A short string that will be used as the filename of the OriginEndpoint URL (defaults to "index").

Origination.documentation:
Control whether origination of video is allowed for this OriginEndpoint. If set to ALLOW, the OriginEndpoint
may by requested, pursuant to any other form of access control. If set to DENY, the OriginEndpoint may not be
requested. This can be helpful for Live to VOD harvesting, or for temporarily disabling origination

StartoverWindowSeconds.documentation:
Maximum duration (seconds) of content to retain for startover playback.
If not specified, startover playback will be disabled for the OriginEndpoint.

TimeDelaySeconds.documentation:
Amount of delay (seconds) to enforce on the playback of live content.
If not specified, there will be no time delay in effect for the OriginEndpoint.

Whitelist.documentation: A list of source IP CIDR blocks that will be allowed to access the OriginEndpoint.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) assigned to the OriginEndpoint.

ChannelId.documentation: The ID of the Channel the OriginEndpoint is associated with.

CreatedAt.documentation: The date and time the OriginEndpoint was created.

Description.documentation: A short text description of the OriginEndpoint.

Id.documentation: The ID of the OriginEndpoint.

ManifestName.documentation: A short string appended to the end of the OriginEndpoint URL.

Origination.documentation:
Control whether origination of video is allowed for this OriginEndpoint. If set to ALLOW, the OriginEndpoint
may by requested, pursuant to any other form of access control. If set to DENY, the OriginEndpoint may not be
requested. This can be helpful for Live to VOD harvesting, or for temporarily disabling origination

StartoverWindowSeconds.documentation:
Maximum duration (seconds) of content to retain for startover playback.
If not specified, startover playback will be disabled for the OriginEndpoint.

TimeDelaySeconds.documentation:
Amount of delay (seconds) to enforce on the playback of live content.

Url.documentation: The URL of the packaged OriginEndpoint for consumption.

DashEncryption.documentation: A Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) encryption configuration.

KeyRotationIntervalSeconds.documentation: Time (in seconds) between each encryption key rotation.

DashPackage.documentation: A Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) packaging configuration.

IncludeIframeOnlyStream.documentation: When enabled, an I-Frame only stream will be included in the output.

ManifestLayout.documentation: Determines the position of some tags in the Media Presentation Description (MPD).  When set to FULL, elements like SegmentTemplate and ContentProtection are included in each Representation.  When set to COMPACT, duplicate elements are combined and presented at the AdaptationSet level. When set to DRM_TOP_LEVEL_COMPACT, content protection elements are placed the MPD level and referenced at the AdaptationSet level.

ManifestWindowSeconds.documentation: Time window (in seconds) contained in each manifest.

MinBufferTimeSeconds.documentation: Minimum duration (in seconds) that a player will buffer media before starting the presentation.

MinUpdatePeriodSeconds.documentation: Minimum duration (in seconds) between potential changes to the Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) Media Presentation Description (MPD).

PeriodTriggers.documentation:
A list of triggers that controls when the outgoing Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH)
Media Presentation Description (MPD) will be partitioned into multiple periods. If empty, the content will not
be partitioned into more than one period. If the list contains "ADS", new periods will be created where
the Channel source contains SCTE-35 ad markers.

Profile.documentation: The Dynamic Adaptive Streaming over HTTP (DASH) profile type.  When set to "HBBTV_1_5", HbbTV 1.5 compliant output is enabled. When set to "DVB-DASH_2014", DVB-DASH 2014 compliant output is enabled.

SegmentDurationSeconds.documentation:
Duration (in seconds) of each segment. Actual segments will be
rounded to the nearest multiple of the source segment duration.

SegmentTemplateFormat.documentation: Determines the type of SegmentTemplate included in the Media Presentation Description (MPD).  When set to NUMBER_WITH_TIMELINE, a full timeline is presented in each SegmentTemplate, with $Number$ media URLs.  When set to TIME_WITH_TIMELINE, a full timeline is presented in each SegmentTemplate, with $Time$ media URLs. When set to NUMBER_WITH_DURATION, only a duration is included in each SegmentTemplate, with $Number$ media URLs.

SuggestedPresentationDelaySeconds.documentation: Duration (in seconds) to delay live content before presentation.

UtcTiming.documentation: Determines the type of UTCTiming included in the Media Presentation Description (MPD)

UtcTimingUri.documentation: Specifies the value attribute of the UTCTiming field when utcTiming is set to HTTP-ISO, HTTP-HEAD or HTTP-XSDATE

Id.documentation: The ID of the Channel to delete.
The ID of the OriginEndpoint to delete.

EncryptionContractConfiguration.documentation:
Use encryptionContractConfiguration to configure one or more content encryption keys for your endpoints that use SPEKE 2.0. 
The encryption contract defines which content keys are used to encrypt the audio and video tracks in your stream. 
To configure the encryption contract, specify which audio and video encryption presets to use.
Note the following considerations when using encryptionContractConfiguration:
encryptionContractConfiguration can be used for DASH or CMAF endpoints that use SPEKE 2.0. SPEKE 2.0 relies on the CPIX 2.3 specification.
You must disable key rotation for this endpoint by setting keyRotationIntervalSeconds to 0.

PresetSpeke20Audio.documentation: A collection of audio encryption presets.

PresetSpeke20Video.documentation: A collection of video encryption presets.

ForbiddenException.documentation: The client is not authorized to access the requested resource.

HlsEncryption.documentation: An HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) encryption configuration.

ConstantInitializationVector.documentation:
A constant initialization vector for encryption (optional).
When not specified the initialization vector will be periodically rotated.

KeyRotationIntervalSeconds.documentation: Interval (in seconds) between each encryption key rotation.

RepeatExtXKey.documentation: When enabled, the EXT-X-KEY tag will be repeated in output manifests.

HlsIngest.documentation: An HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) ingest resource configuration.

IngestEndpoints.documentation: A list of endpoints to which the source stream should be sent.

HlsManifest.documentation: A HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest configuration.

AdMarkers.documentation:
This setting controls how ad markers are included in the packaged OriginEndpoint.
"NONE" will omit all SCTE-35 ad markers from the output.
"PASSTHROUGH" causes the manifest to contain a copy of the SCTE-35 ad
markers (comments) taken directly from the input HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest.
"SCTE35_ENHANCED" generates ad markers and blackout tags based on SCTE-35
messages in the input source.
"DATERANGE" inserts EXT-X-DATERANGE tags to signal ad and program transition events 
in HLS and CMAF manifests. For this option, you must set a programDateTimeIntervalSeconds value 
that is greater than 0.

Id.documentation: The ID of the manifest. The ID must be unique within the OriginEndpoint and it cannot be changed after it is created.

IncludeIframeOnlyStream.documentation: When enabled, an I-Frame only stream will be included in the output.

ManifestName.documentation: An optional short string appended to the end of the OriginEndpoint URL. If not specified, defaults to the manifestName for the OriginEndpoint.

PlaylistType.documentation:
The HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) playlist type.
When either "EVENT" or "VOD" is specified, a corresponding EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE
entry will be included in the media playlist.

PlaylistWindowSeconds.documentation: Time window (in seconds) contained in each parent manifest.

ProgramDateTimeIntervalSeconds.documentation:
The interval (in seconds) between each EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag
inserted into manifests. Additionally, when an interval is specified
ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated every 5 seconds using the
ingest time of the content.
If the interval is not specified, or set to 0, then
no EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tags will be inserted into manifests and no
ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated. Note that irrespective
of this parameter, if any ID3 Timed Metadata is found in HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) input,
it will be passed through to HLS output.

Url.documentation: The URL of the packaged OriginEndpoint for consumption.

HlsManifestCreateOrUpdateParameters.documentation: A HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest configuration.

AdMarkers.documentation:
This setting controls how ad markers are included in the packaged OriginEndpoint.
"NONE" will omit all SCTE-35 ad markers from the output.
"PASSTHROUGH" causes the manifest to contain a copy of the SCTE-35 ad
markers (comments) taken directly from the input HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest.
"SCTE35_ENHANCED" generates ad markers and blackout tags based on SCTE-35
messages in the input source.
"DATERANGE" inserts EXT-X-DATERANGE tags to signal ad and program transition events 
in HLS and CMAF manifests. For this option, you must set a programDateTimeIntervalSeconds value 
that is greater than 0.

PlaylistWindowSeconds.documentation: Time window (in seconds) contained in each parent manifest.

HlsPackage.documentation: An HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) packaging configuration.

AdMarkers.documentation:
This setting controls how ad markers are included in the packaged OriginEndpoint.
"NONE" will omit all SCTE-35 ad markers from the output.
"PASSTHROUGH" causes the manifest to contain a copy of the SCTE-35 ad
markers (comments) taken directly from the input HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) manifest.

IncludeDvbSubtitles.documentation: When enabled, MediaPackage passes through digital video broadcasting (DVB) subtitles into the output.

IncludeIframeOnlyStream.documentation: When enabled, an I-Frame only stream will be included in the output.

PlaylistType.documentation:
The HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) playlist type.
When either "EVENT" or "VOD" is specified, a corresponding EXT-X-PLAYLIST-TYPE
entry will be included in the media playlist.

PlaylistWindowSeconds.documentation: Time window (in seconds) contained in each parent manifest.

ProgramDateTimeIntervalSeconds.documentation:
The interval (in seconds) between each EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tag
inserted into manifests. Additionally, when an interval is specified
ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated every 5 seconds using the
ingest time of the content.
If the interval is not specified, or set to 0, then
no EXT-X-PROGRAM-DATE-TIME tags will be inserted into manifests and no
ID3Timed Metadata messages will be generated. Note that irrespective
of this parameter, if any ID3 Timed Metadata is found in HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) input,

SegmentDurationSeconds.documentation:
Duration (in seconds) of each fragment. Actual fragments will be
rounded to the nearest multiple of the source fragment duration.

UseAudioRenditionGroup.documentation: When enabled, audio streams will be placed in rendition groups in the output.

IngestEndpoint.documentation: An endpoint for ingesting source content for a Channel.

Password.documentation: The system generated password for ingest authentication.

Username.documentation: The system generated username for ingest authentication.

MaxResults.documentation: Upper bound on number of records to return.

BucketName.documentation: The name of an S3 bucket within which harvested content will be exported

ManifestKey.documentation: The key in the specified S3 bucket where the harvested top-level manifest will be placed.

RoleArn.documentation: The IAM role used to write to the specified S3 bucket

SpekeKeyProvider.documentation: A configuration for accessing an external Secure Packager and Encoder Key Exchange (SPEKE) service that will provide encryption keys.

CertificateArn.documentation:
An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a Certificate Manager certificate
that MediaPackage will use for enforcing secure end-to-end data
transfer with the key provider service.

ResourceId.documentation: The resource ID to include in key requests.

An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that AWS Elemental
MediaPackage will assume when accessing the key provider service.

SystemIds.documentation: The system IDs to include in key requests.

Url.documentation: The URL of the external key provider service.

MaxVideoBitsPerSecond.documentation: The maximum video bitrate (bps) to include in output.

MinVideoBitsPerSecond.documentation: The minimum video bitrate (bps) to include in output.

StreamOrder.documentation: A directive that determines the order of streams in the output.

Tags.documentation: A collection of tags associated with a resource

TooManyRequestsException.documentation: The client has exceeded their resource or throttling limits.

UnprocessableEntityException.documentation: The parameters sent in the request are not valid.

TagKeys.documentation: The key(s) of tag to be deleted

Id.documentation: The ID of the Channel.

UpdateOriginEndpointRequest.documentation: Configuration parameters used to update an existing OriginEndpoint.

Description.documentation: A short text description of the OriginEndpoint.

Id.documentation: The ID of the OriginEndpoint to update.

ManifestName.documentation: A short string that will be appended to the end of the Endpoint URL.

Origination.documentation:
Control whether origination of video is allowed for this OriginEndpoint. If set to ALLOW, the OriginEndpoint
may by requested, pursuant to any other form of access control. If set to DENY, the OriginEndpoint may not be
requested. This can be helpful for Live to VOD harvesting, or for temporarily disabling origination

StartoverWindowSeconds.documentation:
Maximum duration (in seconds) of content to retain for startover playback.
If not specified, startover playback will be disabled for the OriginEndpoint.

TimeDelaySeconds.documentation:
Amount of delay (in seconds) to enforce on the playback of live content.
If not specified, there will be no time delay in effect for the OriginEndpoint.

Whitelist.documentation: A list of source IP CIDR blocks that will be allowed to access the OriginEndpoint.

Arn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) assigned to the OriginEndpoint.

ChannelId.documentation: The ID of the Channel the OriginEndpoint is associated with.

CreatedAt.documentation: The date and time the OriginEndpoint was created.

Description.documentation: A short text description of the OriginEndpoint.

Id.documentation: The ID of the OriginEndpoint.

ManifestName.documentation: A short string appended to the end of the OriginEndpoint URL.

Origination.documentation:
Control whether origination of video is allowed for this OriginEndpoint. If set to ALLOW, the OriginEndpoint
may by requested, pursuant to any other form of access control. If set to DENY, the OriginEndpoint may not be
requested. This can be helpful for Live to VOD harvesting, or for temporarily disabling origination

StartoverWindowSeconds.documentation:
Maximum duration (seconds) of content to retain for startover playback.
If not specified, startover playback will be disabled for the OriginEndpoint.

TimeDelaySeconds.documentation:
Amount of delay (seconds) to enforce on the playback of live content.
If not specified, there will be no time delay in effect for the OriginEndpoint.

Url.documentation: The URL of the packaged OriginEndpoint for consumption.

Whitelist.documentation: A list of source IP CIDR blocks that will be allowed to access the OriginEndpoint.
